intro: Lasiandra longistyla, commonly known as the long-styled lasiandra, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. Its unique floral structure features long, slender stamens that extend beyond the petals, giving it its common name. Lasiandra longistyla is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks.
